snippet: In 1960s New York City, “action bowling” was a high-stakes form of gambling in which bowlers faced off for thousands of dollars.
abstract: Ernie Schlegel, Larry Lichstein and Kenny Barber were among the best practitioners of 'action bowling,' high-stakes form of gambling that was popular in New York City in 1960s in which bowlers faced off for thousands of dollars; notorious scene was wrought with bettors, gangsters, thugs and hustlers.
lead_paragraph: In 1960s New York City, “action bowling” was a high-stakes form of gambling in which bowlers faced off for thousands of dollars.

headline.seo: When Thugs and Hustlers Ruled Dark Alleys in New York
headline.main: When Thugs and Hustlers Ruled Dark Alleys
headline.print_headline: When Thugs and Hustlers Ruled Dark Alleys
